title: Designating Cartels and Other Organizations as Foreign Terrorist Organizations and Specially Designated Global Terrorists
summary: This executive order allows the U.S. government to designate certain international criminal organizations as foreign terrorist organizations or specially designated global terrorists. This would impose sanctions and penalties on these groups and anyone providing them with material support.
full_text: For universities like Yale, this order could have a significant financial impact if they have any connections or dealings with the designated groups. Universities may need to carefully review their international partnerships and funding sources to ensure compliance, which could disrupt research, programs, and revenue.

university_impact_areas.name: Workforce & Employment Policy
university_impact_areas.description: Impacts on faculty, staff employment, labor relations, and workforce diversity
